document.title: Tenth Anniversary of University of Tennessee Pro Bono

author.institution: Justice of the Tennessee Supreme Court

document.abstract: U.T. Pro Bono is a student-directed community service organization at the University of Tennessee College of Law. It was founded in 1994. The reception was held April 1, 2004 in Knoxville, Tennessee.
document.publication-title: Tennessee Journal of Law and Policy

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: E. Riley Anderson is a Justice of the Tennessee Supreme Court. In addition to his numerous honors, Justice Anderson received the Tennessee Bar Association's William M. Leech, Jr. Public Service Award in 2001. He is a graduate of the University of Tennessee College of Law.
